class.name: AnimationLibrary
class.description: An animation library stores a set of animations accessible through [StringName] keys, for use with [AnimationPlayer] nodes.

method.name: add_animation
method.description: Adds the [param animation] to the library, accessible by the key [param name].

method.name: get_animation
method.description: Returns the [Animation] with the key [param name]. If the animation does not exist, [code]null[/code] is returned and an error is logged.

method.name: get_animation_list
method.description: Returns the keys for the [Animation]s stored in the library.

method.name: get_animation_list_size
method.description: Returns the key count for the [Animation]s stored in the library.

method.name: has_animation
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the library stores an [Animation] with [param name] as the key.

method.name: remove_animation
method.description: Removes the [Animation] with the key [param name].

method.name: rename_animation
method.description: Changes the key of the [Animation] associated with the key [param name] to [param newname].

signal.name: animation_added
signal.description: Emitted when an [Animation] is added, under the key [param name].

signal.name: animation_changed
signal.description: Emitted when there's a change in one of the animations, e.g. tracks are added, moved or have changed paths. [param name] is the key of the animation that was changed. See also [signal Resource.changed], which this acts as a relay for.

signal.name: animation_removed
signal.description: Emitted when an [Animation] stored with the key [param name] is removed.

signal.name: animation_renamed
signal.description: Emitted when the key for an [Animation] is changed, from [param name] to [param to_name].
